CatDescriptText: Mr. Steve Siko, millworker, 4218 Haldane Street, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 6, 1958, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that too much leniency is shown teenagers who commit crimes?" answer reads: "I don't think that they show them enough leniency. They (the authority) should try to help the kids and encourage them to adjust.  I don't mean to punish them, but instead to give them more of a break.  And if they commit a crime again, there should be no leniency."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Steve Siko wearing dark button down suit jacket, polo shirt, and hat, standing in front of light colored marble wall, store window on left displaying women's hats, store window on right displaying men's shoes
